title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-2.7 - Results of examination
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-2.7 - Results of examination

State Regulations

The result of each written examination as to each
applicant shall be certified to the commissioner by the examining board or
majority thereof as satisfactory or unsatisfactory. If unsatisfactory, the
applicant may upon his written request made within 20 days from notice of the
result have a hearing before the examining board or a member thereof to inquire
into the reasons for the certified result. Within 20 days thereafter the
examining board or the majority thereof shall affirm or alter the certified
result. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
4-2.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
